intro: Hieracium piletocaule, commonly known as the short-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with a rosette of basal leaves and a short, upright stem. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which attracts various pollinators. Hieracium piletocaule is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a winter annual in some regions.
